alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Putnam (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 10:12PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Fairfield, northwestern New Haven, Westchester, eastern Putnam and Rockland Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1011 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of New Preston to Bethel to near Mount Kisco to Wayne. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stamford, Waterbury, Danbury, Shelton, New City, Naugatuck, Ossining, Peekskill, Southbury, New Canaan, Monsey, Nanuet, Haverstraw, Mount Kisco and Suffern. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern New Jersey...and southeastern New York.
